intro: Lyperia, commonly known as the silverleaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and tubular flowers. The leaves are typically opposite and covered in fine, soft hairs that give them their distinctive appearance. Lyperia species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid environments. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in drought conditions.
